Name: Pyongyang
Description: P'yŏngyang (평양 Pyeongyang), with about 2,750,000 inhabitants, is the capital city of North Korea. It is on the Taedong River in the southwest of the country.

Name: Chongjin
Description: Chongjin (청진시) is a city is in the Donghae Coast region of North Korea.

Name: Hamhung
Description: Hamhung (함흥시, 咸興市) is in the Donghae Coast region in North Korea.

Name: Kaechon
Description: Kaechon (Hangul: 개천시, Hanja: 价川市)) is in South Pyongan province in North Korea.

Name: Kaesong
Description: Kaesŏng (개성, 開城) is a city in North Korea, only 8 km from the DMZ with South Korea.

Name: Nampho
Description: Nampho (남포) is in South Pyongan province in North Korea.

Name: Rason
Description: Rason (라선시) (formally Rajin-Sŏnbong) is in the Donghae Coast region of North Korea.

Name: Sinuiju
Description: Sinuiju (신의주시) is in Pyongan province in North Korea.

Name: Wonsan
Description: Wonsan (원산, 元山市) is a city in the Donghae Coast region of North Korea.

Name: Baekdu Mountains
Description: The Baekdu Mountains or Paektu Mountain (Korean: 백두산맥) are a range in the northern part of North Korea spanning the provinces of Ryanggang and Chagang that are of huge symbolic importance to many Koreans.

Name: Panmunjom
Description: Panmunjeom (판문점), also P'anmunjŏm, is on the demarcation line between North and South Korea.
